{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient's symptoms of severe, pulsating pain around the crown of her head, nausea, and sensitivity to light are indicative of a migraine. Ibuprofen is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) that can be used to treat migraines, but it seems to be ineffective in this case. Propranolol is a beta-blocker that is used for migraine prophylaxis, not for acute treatment. 100% oxygen is used for cluster headaches, not migraines. Sumatriptan is a triptan medication that is used for the acute treatment of migraines.", "answer_choice": "D. Sumatriptan"}
